page.title: 01Fertile valley E. of Reston
page.content: The village of Reston lies in a fertile valley with good A1 quality land, and has over the years become an agricultural centre for the farming hinerland. The main railway line runs through village but no longer stops in Reston itself. This led to its development as a cattle market centre, which has in recent years declined. This has resulted in the overall decline of the village,which had a population of 275 in 1981. The village has developed in a linear pattern along the railway line. The decline in agricultural activity as a cattle centre has had an effect on the outlying farms with many properties becoming derelict. Evidence of mans influence in the area can be seen by th removal of fences and the provision of double sized gates, to cater for the modern combine harvester.
